attributes.action: introduce retrospective legislation to enable HMRC to tax MPs on expenses that have been repaid, but not "wholly, exclusively and necessarily incurred from the purpose of performing Parliamentary duties".
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I believe that the recent controversy has shown that a significant number of  expense claims, successfully repaid to MPs actually constitute a  "Benefit in Kind".

This petition requests that the government takes this into consideration and instruct HMRC to pursue these benefits and apply the appropriate amount of taxation.

Going forwards, MPs expenses should have the same rules applied as to all members of the general public.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
